title: User badge display, external website link, and Events/Coming Soon page

requirements.summary: Fetch and display the authenticated user’s issued unique ID and badge (including first-login issuance) without blocking existing registration/profile flows.
acceptanceCriteria: After a successful Internet Identity sign-in, the app requests the caller’s issued ID+badge from the backend and shows it in an appropriate place (e.g., header/account area and/or registration/profile area).
If the backend has not issued an ID+badge yet for that user, the first authenticated load triggers issuance and the UI updates to show the new ID+badge without requiring a page refresh.
If the ID+badge fetch fails, the rest of the app remains usable (no hard crash); the UI shows a non-blocking error or fallback state.

file_operations.description: Create React Query hook(s) to call the backend capability getOrCreateUserBadge() when the user is authenticated, returning loading/error/data states and avoiding hard failures; leverage existing Internet Identity state from the app. (Use the authorization component guidance for authenticated UX patterns and graceful trap/error handling; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

Add a small authenticated-only account area in the header (and optionally mobile menu) that displays the issued unique ID and badge using the new useUserBadge hook, with a non-blocking fallback/error state so navigation and other features still work. (Use the authorization component guidance for login-dependent data display and clearing cached data on logout; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

Display the authenticated user’s issued ID+badge near the top of the registration flow (read-only) using the new useUserBadge hook, ensuring the existing registration form remains usable even if the badge fetch fails. (Use the authorization component guidance for authenticated data fetching patterns; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.)

requirements.summary: Add a clearly labeled external link to the Web2 website and brief landing-page copy explaining the project objective (ICP real-world network).
acceptanceCriteria: The app includes a clearly labeled external link to https://www.dmc-technologies.fr (e.g., in header and/or footer) that opens in a new tab with rel="noopener noreferrer".
The landing page includes brief English copy explaining the objective (creating an ICP real-world network) and references the external website for more details.
No attempt is made to embed or scrape the external website; it is linked as an external URL only.

file_operations.description: Add a clearly labeled external link to https://www.dmc-technologies.fr in the header navigation and/or footer, opening in a new tab with rel="noopener noreferrer" (external URL only; no embedding).

Update landing-page content to include brief English copy stating the objective is creating an ICP real-world network and referencing https://www.dmc-technologies.fr for more details (link only; do not embed/scrape).

requirements.summary: Create an Events/Coming Soon page and add it to navigation with working TanStack Router routing.
acceptanceCriteria: A new route/page exists (e.g., /events) reachable from the header navigation on desktop and mobile.
The Events/Coming Soon page contains English copy that clearly states: Step 1 is creating an ID; the next step of the Web3/ICP network is coming soon.
The page includes a link to https://www.dmc-technologies.fr for additional information.
Routing works with the existing TanStack Router setup and does not break existing routes (/ , /register, /directory).

file_operations.description: Create an Events (Coming Soon) page with English copy explaining that Step 1 is creating an ID and the next step of the Web3/ICP network is coming soon, and include an external link to https://www.dmc-technologies.fr (open new tab, rel="noopener noreferrer").
Register a new TanStack Router route for the Events page (e.g., /events) and include it in the route tree alongside existing routes, ensuring existing routes continue to work.
Wire the Events page into app navigation for both desktop header nav and mobile menu so the /events route is reachable, without disrupting existing links to /, /register, and /directory.
